Directions
For the Sausage Balls:
Remove ground sausage from refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes before preparing.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Adjust oven racks to upper-middle and lower-middle positions. Preheat oven to 375℉ (190℃) and line two baking sheets with parchment paper; set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, pepper, and buttermilk powder until combined. Add the shredded cheese and toss until cheese is coated with flour mixture.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Add sausage and melted butter to the cheese and flour mixture and, using your hands, knead until the mixture comes together evenly and there are no pockets of flour remaining, about 5 minutes.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Working with one ball at a time, pinch off heaping 1 tablespoon size portion and roll into walnut-size ball. Place shaped sausage balls on prepared baking sheets, divided evenly and spaced evenly apart. You should have about 30 prepared sausage balls total. Bake both sheet pans at the same time, rotating trays halfway through baking, until sausage balls are browned on the bottom and starting to turn golden on the top, and cooked through about 20 minutes.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Remove from the oven and transfer sausage balls to a paper towel-lined plate.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
For the Dijonnaise Sauce:
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk to combine Dijon mustard, mayonnaise, and honey.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Transfer sausage balls to a serving platter and serve with prepared Dijonnaise sauce.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Notes
Bulk Italian sweet or hot sausage can be substituted for the breakfast sausage in this recipe.
This recipe can be easily doubled.
Make-Ahead and Storage
Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days.
